intro: Chamaecrista unijuga, commonly known as the single-flowered burr legume, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its distinctive pod-like fruits and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or disturbed soils and thrives in full sun. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in racemes, and the plant is often found in open woodlands and along roadsides. Chamaecrista unijuga is noted for its hardy nature and ability to adapt to various environmental conditions.
